benchmark_details.name: Word Synchronization Challenge
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark introduces the Word Synchronization Challenge, a novel benchmark to evaluate large language models (LLMs) in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). It assesses LLMs’ ability to mimic human cognitive processes through word associations, simulating complex human interactions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess LLMs’ capacity to predict and adapt within social interactions using their response to word associations.

data.source: Dynamic game simulation involving multiple LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Success rate is determined by the proportion of rounds where both participants produced the same word. Average rounds measure the mean number of turns before achieving a match.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate better performance in mimicking human thought processes during word association tasks.
methodology.validation: Initial findings highlighted model performance across different versions of LLMs
